STATIC_heading.text: ABBREVIATIONS

STATIC_table.text:
ABabortionHDNhemolytic disease of the newborn
AFPalpha-fetoprotein—high levels in amniotic ﬂuid of fetus or maternal serum indicate increased risk of neurologic birth defects in the infant.HPV human papillomavirus
ARTAssisted Reproductive Techniques including IVF and sperm donationHRT hormone replacement therapy
BRCA1 BRCA2breast cancer 1 and 2 —genetic mutations associated with increased risk for breast cancer HSGhysterosalpingography
BSEbreast self-examinationIUDintrauterine device; contraceptive 
CA-125protein marker elevated in ovarian cancer IDCinvasive ductal carcinoma 
C-section, CScesarean section IRDSinfant respiratory distress syndrome 
CIN cervical intraepithelial neoplasia IVF in vitro fertilization 
CIS carcinoma in situ LEEP loop electrocautery excision procedure 
CVS chorionic villus sampling LH luteinizing hormone 
Cx cervix LMP last menstrual period 
D&C dilation (dilatation) and curettage multip multipara; multiparous 
DCIS ductal carcinoma in situ; a precancerous breast lesion that indicates a higher risk for invasive ductal breast cancer OB obstetrics 
DUB dysfunctional uterine bleeding para 2-0-1-2 a woman’s reproductive history: 2 full-term infants, 0 preterm, 1 abortion, and 2 living children 
FHR fetal heart rate Pap test test for cervical or vaginal cancer 
FNA ﬁne needle aspiration PID pelvic inﬂammatory disease 
FSH follicle-stimulating hormone PMS premenstrual syndrome 
Ggravida (pregnant) primip primipara; primiparous 
GnRH gonadotropin-releasing hormone— secreted by the hypothalamus to stimulate release of FSH and LH from the pituitary glandSLN biopsy or SNBsentinel lymph node biopsy—blue dye or a radioisotope (or both) identiﬁes the ﬁrst lymph node draining the breast lymphatics 
GYN gynecology TAH-BSO total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy
hCG or HCGhuman chorionic gonadotropin UAE uterine artery embolization
VH vaginal hysterectomy
